channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024050508
item.description:
Report X-2024050508

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: STAUNTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE BROUGHT TO QA FOR DAMAGE INSPECTION FROM UNLOAD DURING INBOUND SORT WITH EXTERIOR AS PREVIOUSLY MARKED, LEAKING/POURING LIQUID OUT OF BOTTOM OF PLASTIC PAIL. UPON INSPECTION I FOUND PREVIOUSLY STATED ITEM DAMAGED/ABLE TO LEAK OUT OVER HALF DUE TO NO EXTERNAL PACKAGING FOR PROTECTION DURING SHIPPING ALLOWING CONTAINER TO BECOME CRACKED/LIDS TO BECOME LOOSE.

item.description:

  • State: NJ

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, on its side, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report E-2024050243
item.description:
Report E-2024050243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/04/2024 Veolia employees were unloading a cubic yard box into a trailer at the 10-Day transfer area in Veolia, South Windsor, CT facility when an employee noticed a few drops of liquid coming out of a cubic yard box. Only a couple of drops were observed under the cubic yard box. The employees noticed the leak right away and quickly put down some spill pads to contain the leak. Employees proceeded to open the container and observed many inner paint related material containers were dented or leaking inside the cubic yard box. Employees righted the inner containers, poured absorbent into the cubic yard box to prevent any further leaks, and transported the container to the ultimate disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2024050207
item.description:
Report E-2024050207

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a battery acid release from a 2113-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of battery acid released to a 6’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 30’ x 2’ area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading; the battery fell over in transit. Absorbents and soda ash were worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents, pallet pieces, and debris were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged battery was up righted and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

Manager Robinson called the shipper and told them to get an OTMA because the car leaked below the valve body.

item.title: Report E-2024050192
item.description:
Report E-2024050192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 1, 2024, at 1917 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Magnum K (UN3266, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was caused by a puncture to the drum and contained to a small area of the dock floor under the pallet. Terminal personnel placed absorbents on the release prior to the contractor’s arrival. Contractors placed the damaged drum containing product in a 95-gallon plastic overpack. Contractors then neutralized and collected the spent absorbents with the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 95-gallon overpack DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024050190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, twelve (12) 50-pound bags of UN1487 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged bags and containerized them in four (4) 35-gallon drums. Crews then utilized a HEPA filter vacuum to collect the product from the dock floor. TLE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate any residual product. All UN1487 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3266-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged product, and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2024050233

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WESTLAND
  • State: MI

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While transferring the containers from a Veolia trailer to the 3rd party trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility a Veolia employee noticed two drums containing a flammable corrosive material to be leaking. The drums appeared to have been pinched by a forklift when they were loaded at the shipper's site. The dent created weak spots in the drums causing the leak. The liquid was contained in the trailer and was between 1/2 to 1 gallon. The drums were overpacked for continued transportation.

  • Description: On April 26, 2024, four (4) damaged jugs of UN2014 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged jugs for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the release and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2014 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024050169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged by improper stacking and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed neutralizers to the dock floor and exterior of the tote and utilized hand tools and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted surfaces. LSH patched the one (1) 275-gallon tote, placed absorbent pads beneath the tote and wrapped the tote in a poly sheet. Crews appropriately labeled and staged the poly sheet wrapped 275-gallon tote onsite. All spent absorbent pads and generated waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail for disposal.

  • City: CONLEY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 24, 2024, at 0858 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Conley, Georgia regarding the release of a total of 2 gallons of Muriatic Acid (UN1789, 8, II) from (15) 1-gallon poly jugs. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by the cargo being improperly loaded and was contained to a small area of the trailer floor, a 15ft x 3ft area of the concrete dock, multiple areas of asphalt and it also impacted a tire. Contractors were able to neutralize the release then clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (3) 55-gallon DF’s and was staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050210
item.description:
Report E-2024050210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party hauler was hooking onto a Veolia's outbound trailer. When the trailer made contact with the king pin, a yellow liquid began to drop slowly out of the trailer, just behind the tractor. The driver was instructed to pull away from the van. A Veolia employee then went to grab a bag of solid absorb and placed it below the leak. Approximately 4oz of the liquid was spilled onto the cement floor before it stopped. The trailer was then unloaded. During this time, the employees noticed that 3 drums were leaking from their bottom and sides. The bottom of the drums were corroded which caused pinholes on the bottom portion of the body of the drums. Employees then overpacked the 3 drums into poly containers. Approximately 4 oz of the liquid was released onto the trailer's floor. These 3 drums were profiled as a solid by the vendor. Possible misclassification of the waste along with improper packaging may have caused the leak. All three drums were placed into a poly 85 salvage drum. The manifest was then rejected back to the broker, and the broker came back to pick up their drums.

item.title: Report E-2024050159
item.description:
Report E-2024050159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: Grafton
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Ross Transportation Services, Inc. (RTS)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At about 17:30, a woman called RTS stating that she was following a tanker pulled by an RTS truck on RT 83 and residual material from the tanker had splashed onto her car (a red crossover Mercedes-Benz). RTS was transporting a tanker from American Woodmark Corp. and had dropped the tanker in its transfer line. Records indicate the driver had noted a faulty seal at the top of the tanker on his post trip inspection. Investigation confirmed that the grey material that had splashed down the side of the tanker, as well as on the ground from the manhole overflow tube appeared similar to the specks splashed on the car. No material was on the roadway. The spill in the transfer line was cleaned up, and a reportable spill report filed. The citizen arrived on site to show us the material on her car, which were small droplets of grey material. The gasket/seal has been replaced.

item.title: Report E-2024050137
item.description:
Report E-2024050137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: NEWNAN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNW experienced a UN1824 Gardobond Additive H 7212 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 15' x 15' area of the concrete dock floor, a 1' x 1' area of the concrete lot below the bay, and a 1' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture caused by the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents and absorbent powder were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to two 2’ x 2’ areas of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was dried with absorbents for disposal. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024050335
item.description:
Report X-2024050335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag with suspicions of internal leakage. Upon inspection, suspicion was confirmed by a semi sealed lid on the drum containing paint. Lid attachments weren't fully tighten on to the drum causing a slight escape area. Paint spilled and soiled drum, drying up all around the lid opening. Most of leakage was contained by a plastic bag that drum was placed in to be shipped out, slight paint did escape and soiled the inner & outer packaging box. Drum was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition from PGH.

  • Description: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X1GALLON (PLASTIC BOTTLES) QUALITY CHEMICAL DENATURED ALCOHOL (ETHANOL) CAP ALL 4 BOTTLES WERE TURNED DOWN AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.description:
Report E-2024050128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of Quick Cure 275 arrived forked and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel placed the damaged bags in one (1) drum liner, then utilized a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All debris was collected in one (1) separate drum liner. Finally, the crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to finish the remediation. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) additional drum liners. The three (3) drum liners were placed in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050136
item.description:
Report E-2024050136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, seven (7) 2.5-gallon pails of UN1791 were damaged in transit due to improper securement and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted surface until a neutral pH was obtained. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove all free-standing product from the impacted surfaces. A Sawzall was used to dismantle the impacted pallet for disposal purposes. The seven (7) damaged 2.5 gallon pails and all UN1791 impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS THERE IS ONE ORANGE 52V 30AH EMOVE CRUISER. THERE IS A RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM ION BATTERY CONTAINED IN THE SCOOTER. OUTER BOX DOES NOT HAVE ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS. OUTER BOX DOES HAVE 52V 30.5AH LG BATTERY PREPRINTED ON TWO ENDS. ONE END IS PARTIALLY COVERED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 77R96A, VORO MOTORS INC, 14350 ARMINTA ST, PANORAMA CITY, CA 91402.

item.description:

  • City: BLYTHE

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL that was strapped down too tightly crushing the body and causing the lid to pop open. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release that impacted the plastic shrink wrap in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor overpacked the damaged, leaking PAIL, containerized the impacted shrink wrap, and cleaned-up the release with absorbent rags. In total, two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024050292
item.description:
Report X-2024050292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A HEAVY TOOLBOX FOR INVESTIGATION OF THE CONTENTS DUE TO THE LOADER SEEING SOME TYPE OF FLAMMABLE ITEM THROUGH THE TOP OF THE TOOLBOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH TWO MILWAUKEE DRILLS AMONG VARIOUS OTHER FLAMMABLE ITEMS. THERE IS (1) 4 OUNCE CONTAINER OF LIQUID TAPE (UN1133, ADHESIVES), (3) PAINT-RITER LIQUID PAINT MARKERS (UN1263, PAINT), (2) 1 OUNCE TUBES OF CROSS CHECK TORQUE SEAL (UN1263, PAINT), (1) 5.6 OUNCE CAN OF MAG TORCH BUTANE (UN2037, RECEPTACLES SMALL CONTAINING GAS) AND (1) LIGHTER (UN1057, LIGHTERS). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER TOOLBOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS DISCOVERED AND INSPECTED PRIOR TO ACTUALLY BEING LOADED ON A FLIGHT.

THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DROPPED OFF AT THE UPS STORE #3065 IN CATHEDRAL CITY, CA AND SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RX3153, SELL YOUR CELL LLC, 74855 JONI DRIVE, SUITE 4, PALM DESERT CA 92260.

item.title: Report E-2024050068
item.description:
Report E-2024050068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of material released from four (4) 1-gallon plastic jugs. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050055
item.description:
Report E-2024050055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: WALTERBORO
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding five torn 55lb bags of Caustic Soda Beads. The reason for the incident is improper loading as the bags were torn by the trailer wall. This resulted in an estimated release of 250lbs of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 15’x4’ area. A Contractor was called to overpack the damaged bags, cut-up the impacted tote, neutralize the trailer floor using a Vinegar Solution, and containerized the ripped shrink wrap. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. The remaining product was repalletized and will ship on to the Consignee. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were impacted by this incident.

Vented caps used but orientation arrows were not applied to two sides of package.

item.title: Report E-2024050032
item.description:
Report E-2024050032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft and 10ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) pound of material was released due to three (3) plastic bags being ripped by the trailer wall. Miller Environmental Group personnel recovered the released material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: Hodgkins
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1510
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PPRX 663916 was found in the BNSF Railway Hogkins yard leaking from the top of the car when the car was moved. Upon inspection, it was determined that PPRX 663916 was leaking from the manway and released approximately 1 gallon of product. A BNSF contractor was dispatched, inspected the car and found the manway gasket deteriorated and one of 6 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. The contractor installed a new manway gasket, properly secured the car and BNSF released it to destination.

item.title: Report E-2024050027
item.description:
Report E-2024050027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that seven (7) ounces of material was released due to a loose cap on one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the cap and used absorbent pads to clean the drum and then deployed granular absorbent and a neutralizer to the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The 55-gallon poly drum was then shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On April 25, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured in transit and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN12-impacted trailer and terminal yard. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums. The drums of waste and the damaged drum were staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On April 25, 2024, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for further disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050053
item.description:
Report E-2024050053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1121 Hrs. on 4-21-2024, the WLE Rook Yard Conductor found tank car NATX 318056 leaking from the manway on top the car. He called the WLE Yardmaster who then contacted myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. I called Specialized Professional Services out of Washington, PA to go look at the car. They determined that the manway was indeed leaking. The found that the bolts were tight. They opened the lid and found that the seal looked new and that there was not any compression markings at the point of the manway safety bolts. They felt that the safety bolts did not have enough threads on them to tighten to the point that the gasket would compress. The installed a nozzle gasket, to replace the ring gasket, and then was able to get the lid to tighten fully. I had suggested to them that maybe the manway lid was improperly positioned on the nozzle causing the metal of the lid to hit the metal of the nozzle, thereby not letting the lid close tightly. They said they did not check for that and therefore could not confirm that idea. They closed the lid, tightened the bolts and installed new seal # 8418988 on the manway lid. They had also checked for leaks in the Roll Over Protection Housing but found none and then installed new seal 8418983 on that lid. The car was then released for service and after the car was moved, there was no leak noticed.

item.title: Report I-2024030022
item.description:
Report I-2024030022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T00:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was found to be non compliant during FRA inspection for loose manway bolts, subsequently the car was found to leak from under the dome lid while being moved to a repair spot, our contract Haz-Mat response team was called out and found that there was no dome lid gasket, one was applied and the manway bolts were secured as required.
